content.value_statement: Building performant React Native apps requires following platform-specific patterns for lists, animations, and state management. This skill provides 35+ AI agent rules for optimized mobile development.
actual_capabilities: Apply list performance optimizations including virtualization with FlashList and item memoization
Implement animations correctly using Reanimated with GPU-friendly properties
Use native navigation components over JavaScript-based navigators
Optimize UI patterns with Pressable, native modals, and safe area handling
Structure React Native monorepos with proper native dependency management
Follow React Compiler requirements for function handling and shared values
limitations: Does not execute code or modify files directly
Provides guidance only - user must implement changes
Focused on React Native and Expo - not general React or web development
Rules reflect current best practices and may change with framework updates

use_cases.title: Optimize List Performance in React Native Apps

use_cases.description: When adding gestures or animations, use GPU-friendly properties and the correct Reanimated hooks to maintain 60fps performance.

use_cases.title: Structure React Native Monorepos
use_cases.description: When setting up monorepo projects with Expo or React Native, follow native dependency and version management rules to avoid build issues.

output_examples.input: How should I structure list items to avoid re-renders in React Native FlatList?
output: Use React.memo() on list item components
Avoid creating style objects inline during render
Extract callback functions outside the component
Use useCallback() for event handlers passed to items
Consider FlashList for large lists (1000+ items)

output_examples.input: What properties can I safely animate without causing re-layouts?
output: Safe to animate: opacity, transform (translateX/Y, scale, rotate)
Avoid animating: width, height, padding, margin, border
Use useDerivedValue for computed animation values
Prefer Gesture.Tap over Pressable for simple tap interactions

best_practices: Prioritize list performance rules first - scrolling smoothness is critical for mobile UX
Use native navigation components (native stack, native tabs) for production apps
Apply memoization early rather than debugging performance issues later
anti_patterns: Avoid inline style objects in list items - define them outside render
Do not use && for conditional rendering with potentially falsy values
Avoid calling measure() on views - use onLayout callback instead

faq.question: Does this skill modify my code directly?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides rules and guidance for AI agents to follow. The actual code modifications are performed by the AI agent based on these guidelines.

faq.question: How many rules are included in this skill?
faq.answer: The skill contains 35+ rules across 13 categories, prioritized from critical (list performance) to low impact (font configuration).

faq.question: Are these rules specific to Expo?
faq.answer: Most rules apply to both Expo and bare React Native projects. Some rules like font config plugins are Expo-specific.

faq.question: How should I prioritize applying these rules?
faq.answer: Start with list performance and animation rules, as these directly impact user experience. Navigation and UI pattern rules are next, followed by state management and rendering optimizations.

faq.question: Do these rules work with React Native New Architecture?
faq.answer: Yes. The rules are designed to be compatible with both the classic and new architecture. Some optimizations may have different performance characteristics.

faq.question: How often are these rules updated?
faq.answer: Rules are maintained by Vercel and updated as React Native, Expo, and related libraries evolve. Check the GitHub repository for the latest version.
